intro: Niebuhria aethiopica, commonly known as the Ethiopian euphorbia, is a succulent plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its stems to survive drought conditions. Niebuhria aethiopica is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
